me pour you some sherbet. Thank you so much,

(Hayme) Aslıhan. Aybars.
The prosecutor was going to give medicine to the herds. Go and
help him.
-Okay, Grandma Hayme. -Okay, Grandma Hayme.
(Music)

text: Hayme Ana, belli ki bir şey vardır. Diyesin hele.
english: Hayme Ana, something is clearly going on. Just say it. Don't keep them in suspense
I received news from Söğüt, my daughter.
Ertuğrul Bey and his Alps... ...
caught fire with Dragos' men.
Bamsi was there too.

text: Hayme Ana'm, Bamsı'ya fena bir şey mi oldu yoksa?
english: Mother Hayme, has something terrible happened to Bamsı ? He was
wounded in the fight. Is he
injured?

text: Ağır mıdır yarası? Ne hâldedir anam, söyleyesin!
english: Is his wound serious? How is my mother doing, tell me!

text: Bacım, metin olasın. Gereken yapılmış. Artuk Bey yanındaymış.
english: Sister, may you be strong. The necessary steps have been taken. Artuk Bey was with him. I wo
n't feel at ease until I see Bamsi.
My daughter, just calm down...
...just get a grip.
Now Söğüt is not a safe place.

text: Ertuğrul Bey bizim dahi gitmemize müsaade etmedi.
english: Ertuğrul Bey didn't even allow us to leave.
Bamsi, too...
...has suffered many wounds like this.

text: Anam, ne edeyim öyleyse, söyle, ne edeyim?
english: Mother, what should I do then, tell me, what should I do? Just sit down
Look, my daughter, Bamsi is your husband...
...and he is also our son.
We would have gone too if necessary.
(Hayme) They will also bring Bamsi here.

text: Sana düşen bel bağır paralayıp yas tutmak değil...
english: Your duty is not to grieve and mourn...
...but to look after your tent, your children, and wait for your husband.
(Sad music) My
sister.
(Sad music)
(Melikshah) Do I have permission, my lord?
Come, Melikshah.

text: Beyim, İlbilge Hatun geldi. Seninle görüşmek ister.
english: My lord, Ilbilge Hatun has arrived. He wants to meet with you.
-Bring it in. -The order is yours, sir.
(The door opened) Please
come in, Ilbilge Hatun.
(The door closed)
Welcome, İlbilge Hatun. It's
great to see you, Ertuğrul Bey. I had no

text: Bana verdiğin sözü er geç tutacağından hiç şüphem yoktu.
english: doubt that you would eventually keep your promise. You did not let
my father's blood go unavenged.
You have done justice. May
God be pleased with you.

text: Adalet yalnız soysuz bir katilin kanıyla değil...
english: Justice will be achieved not only with the blood of a vile murderer...
...but when all the enemies around us are eliminated...
...and hearts are at peace . Are
there any other enemies?
Your father's killer is dead. But...
...neither for Mr. Umur...

text: ...ne de obamızın şerefli ahalisi için adalet...
english: ...nor for the honorable people of our tribe ...
...justice has yet to be served.
What would you like to say?
Albastı.

text: Dragos, Albastı'yla iş tutmuştur İlbilge Hatun.
english: Dragos has made a deal with Albastı, İlbilge Hatun.
I believe my older brother killed Albastı. He didn't die
. He played
a trick on us.

text: İmdi fitneyi büyüterek zehir saçmaya devam eder.
english: Now he continues to spread poison by fanning the flames of discord .
How are we going to catch this scoundrel?
When you went after Aybars...

text: ...seninle vuruşan yüzü yaralı bir adamdan bahsetmiştin.
english: ...you mentioned a man with a scarred face who had fought with you . Have

text: Onu daha sonra hiç gördün mü?
english: you ever seen him since then?

text: (İlbilge dış ses) Ağabeyimle ne işler çevirirsin?
english: (Ilbilge's voiceover) What kind of schemes are you and my brother up to? Did

text: Aybars'ı kaçırmanı ağabeyim mi emretti? Söyle!
english: my older brother order you to kidnap Aybars? Like this ! I'm telling
you, Ilbilge Hatun. Have
you seen that scoundrel?

text: Albastı'yı bulmamız için bu malumat çok mühimdir.
english: This information is crucial for us to find Albastı.
Ilbilge Hatun.

text: Eğer bir şey bilip de saklarsan...
english: If you know something and keep it secret...

text: ...bil ki yarın birçok masumun kanına sebep olursun.
english: know that tomorrow you will be responsible for the bloodshed of many innocent people.
I saw him.
Where? In
our village.
(Suspense music) In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the
Most Merciful. Even if

text: Kırk tilki kırk gün düşünse, aklına bile gelmez beyim.
english: forty foxes thought about it for forty days, it wouldn't occur to them, my lord . Even I
was surprised by the game you played. Baturalp, your

text: Pusatının iki tarafı da keskin olmalı Baturalp.
english: weapon must be sharp on both sides .
When everyone thinks they're going to cut with one side...
...you have to make your move with the other.

text: Ertuğrul Bey, Dragos’un adamlarını yutmak için yaman tuzak kurmuş.
english: Ertuğrul Bey has set a clever trap to ensnare Dragos's men. I wonder if

text: Acep bizi de mi bu tuzakla açığa çıkarmak isterdi beyim?
english: my lord wanted to expose us with this trap as well ? He has no

text: Bizden şüpheleneceği hiçbir delil yok elinde.
english: evidence to make him suspect us. He saw with his own eyes
how we fought for him...
how we risked our lives ...

text: Gayrı içinde bugüne dek bir şüphe vardıysa da...
english: Even if there had been any doubts until today...
... I have eliminated them all with the move I made today.
(Sırma) Do you have permission, brother?
Come here, my beautiful sister.
What's wrong, Sırma? Smoke comes out of his head. What

text: Bu gördüğün etrafımızda yanan ateşin dumanıdır ağabey.
english: you see here is the smoke from the fire burning all around us, brother.
What are you talking about? Come on then.

text: O adam, hani obaya getirip tedavi ettirdiğin.
english: That man, the one you brought to the village and had treated.
What happened to that man?

text: Ablam yine rahat durmadı. Bir şeylerden işkillenmiş olmalı ki...
english: My sister still wouldn't stay quiet. He must have become suspicious of something, so he
followed the man and intercepted him. I

text: Ben de adam konuşamasın diye okumla vurdum.
english: shot him with my arrow so he couldn't speak. Did
the man die, Sırma?
I don't know, brother.
My sister started following me.

text: Ben de izimi kaybettirmek için atımı boş yolladım.
english: To cover my tracks, I sent my horse away empty.

text: Sonra yürüyerek adamı vurduğum yere gittim.
english: Then I walked to the place where I shot the man.
But there was no body.
Someone came and took it.

text: Kim almış ola ki? Nereye götürürler?
english: Who could have bought it? Where will they take them? Is it
İlbilge?
Vultures and ravens aren't food, are they? Most
likely, my sister bought it.
Ilbilge. You've really gone too far

text: Bu defa haddini iyice aştın bacım.
english: this time, sister.
You swim in water that's deeper than your neck.
-Where is he now? -He hasn't come to the camp yet.
-Perhaps he went to Söğüt. -To Söğüt?
Why would he go to Söğüt? He went to see the severed head of our
father's murderer .
(Suspense music) Don't give anything away when you arrive

text: Sakın geldiğinde bir şey belli etme.
Ben onun ne haltlar karıştırdığını öğrenirim.
english: I'll find out what kind of mischief he's up to .
He had arrived wounded, disguised as a merchant.
Then he left the camp. I went after him. I
followed him, then I confronted him.

text: Bizim obada ne işi olduğunu sordum.
english: I asked what he was doing in our village. I asked
who ordered Aybars to be kidnapped .
I asked, "Would you do business with him?"
Just as he was about to answer...

text: ...nereden geldiğini, kimin attığını anlayamadığım bir ok onu vurdu.
english: ... an arrow struck him, its origin and the shooter being unknown. Is he
dead?
He was seriously injured. Just in case, I thought I

text: Her ihtimale karşı belki onu konuştururum diye...
english: might get him to talk...
...he couldn't bear the wound and died.
You took such a risk, knowing full well that they would try to kill you. Do you
think I care, Ertuğrul Bey?
The day I stray from justice...
that is the day I die. It is
better to die than to live with that shame.
Why did that man come to your village? Do you
suspect anyone? Was there anything
you suspected?
Ilbilge Hatun...
...you heard what happened in Söğüt today.
My intention was to join forces with Dragos's soldiers and

text: ...onu kurtarmak için gözünü karartan Albastı’yı yakalamaktı.
english: capture Albastı, who was determined to rescue him.
Every moment you remain silent...
...will return to us, to our communities, with blood...
...and discord.

text: Alplerimiz birçok kez yaralı geldiler obaya.
english: Our Alpine warriors have returned to the camp wounded many times .
My older brother was also injured.

text: İşkillendim, ne oldu diye sordum. Beni geçiştirdi.
english: I became suspicious and asked what had happened. He brushed me off.

text: Obamızın başına kötü bir şey gelmesinden korktum.
english: I was afraid something bad would happen to our tribe.
I'm still afraid. You have always proven that

text: Her daim adalet peşinde koştuğunu ispat ettin.
english: you pursue justice. Will you pursue

text: İmdi yine adaletin peşinde koşacak mısın?
english: justice again now ? Can

text: Bu yolda her şeyi kaldırabilir misin?
english: you handle everything on this path?
I'll remove it, God willing.
Albastı...
...even if he's your older brother?
What do you say, Ertuğrul Bey?
My older brother is up to something. But
... that's not all.

text: Ben de çok düşündüm İlbilge Hatun.
english: I've thought about it a lot too, İlbilge Hatun.

text: Lakin bugüne dek olan bütün hadiseler ağabeyini işaret eder.
english: However, all events to date point to his older brother.
What are those events? The people who
kidnapped Aybars were also Albastı's men.

text: Sen o adamlardan birini kendi gözlerinle...
english: You said you saw one of those men with your own eyes...

text: ...hem vuruşmada hem de obada gördüğünü söyledin.
english: ...both in the fight and in the camp.
(Ertuğrul) You went after that man.
I'm sure it was your older brother who shot that man...
...or ordered the shooting.
I won't believe it unless I see it with my own eyes.
You will see him with your own eyes, İlbilge Hatun.
(Ertuğrul) What happens next? Can
you handle what comes next?
If Albastı is my older brother...
...their blood is permissible for you.

text: Ben de bu uğurda her şeyi yapmaya hazırım.
english: I am ready to do anything for this cause. I would
even risk death.
(Suspense music)
(Hafsa) May I, Mr. Artuk?
Come, Hafsa Hatun. Come.
Bamsi. Bamsi.
Bamsi. Oh, you who blossomed within me

text: Ey benim bir yayla çiçeği gibi...
english: like a mountain flower...

text: Ey benim her daim duman gibi gözümde tüten erim.
english: Oh, my love, who always lingers in my eyes like smoke.

text: Sen düşmanına yama, bize tatlı sözlü oldun.
english: You were a sycophant to your enemy, but sweet-spoken to us. My lord, with a heart of fire and a valiant spirit
. Was it destined for us to

text: Alnımızın yazısında seni böyle de mi görmek varmış?
english: see you like this too?
Bamsi.
Your children are waiting for you.

text: Hadi kalkasın. Hadi kalkasın ne olur.
english: Come on, get up. Please get up.
(Sad music)
Artuk Bey, how is my brave son doing? Will it be
alright?
(Sad music)
Hafsa Hatun, the sword wound is deep. It
took me quite a while to stop the bleeding. The

text: Aldığı darbe sıradan bir insanı öldürecek kadar tehlikelidir.
english: blow he received was dangerous enough to kill an ordinary person.

text: Lakin şükürler olsun ki Bamsı’nın gücü kuvveti...
english: But thankfully, Bamsi's strength and power...
...were enough to heal that wound.

text: Yine de tedbirli olmamız icap eder.
english: Nevertheless, we need to be cautious. We'll
wait and see. Anything beyond that...
...is God's will.
(Sad music)
Brother, my sister has arrived. Let's see what happens
Congratulations, big brother!
Ertuğrul Bey has avenged us.
Where do you come from? I went to see the

text: Babamızın katilinin uğursuz kellesini görmeye gittim.
english: ominous head of our father's murderer . Have
you seen Ertuğrul Bey too?
I wanted to see it. But he wasn't available.

text: Bizans’tan bir elçi gelmiş, onunla görüşürmüş.
english: An envoy from Byzantium had arrived, and he was going to meet with him.
They didn't allow it. May neither

text: Senin de, Alplerimizin de kılıcı kertilmesin.
english: your sword nor the sword of our Alps ever be sharpened .
Together with our Ertuğrul Bey... ...you have dealt with
Dragos's soldiers . Did you

text: Bir tek Söğüt’e mi gittin bugün?
english: only go to Söğüt today? Didn't
you stop by anywhere else?
No way, where would I go? Alps found traces of

text: Obanın yakınlarında kan izleri bulmuş Alpler.
english: blood near the village .

text: Belli ki bir şeyler olmuş. Biz de senin için endişelendik.
english: Clearly, something happened. We were worried about you too.
There is nothing to worry about.

text: Nice vakittir bu kadar huzurlu olmadım.
english: I haven't felt this peaceful in a long time. Thank God

text: Babamın kanı yerde kalmadı çok şükür.
english: my father's blood did not go unavenged.
Thank god.
I heard that Bamsi Alp was wounded.
Brother, I think...

text: ...bu akşam Ertuğrul Beylere gidip, hem geçmiş olsun diyelim...
english: ...I'd like to go to Ertuğrul Bey's house this evening, both to offer my condolences and to express
my gratitude.

text: Malum, görmedim onu. Sen ne dersin?
english: Obviously, I haven't seen him. What do you say?
You've thought this through well.

text: Ertuğrul Bey kargaşa bittikten sonra bilahare görüşelim dediydi.
english: Ertuğrul Bey had said that we should meet again after the chaos had subsided.
Let's go and see.
With your permission then.
(Suspense music)
He's telling an outright lie.

text: Niye yüzüne vurmadın ki bugün ettiklerini ağabey?
english: Why didn't you confront him about what he did today, brother?
He would have realized that we were the ones who shot him. That

text: İşte o vakit her şey açığa çıkardı.
english: 's when everything was revealed. We won't reveal anything until we

text: Hem adamı nereye sakladığını öğrenmeden hiçbir şey belli etmeyeceğiz.
english: find out where he's hiding the man .

text: Bakalım neden o adamdan bu kadar işkillendi.
english: Let's see why she became so suspicious of that man .

text: Kayı Obası'nda her adımını, her sözünü takip edeceğiz.
english: We will follow every step and every word of his in the Kayı tribe. Keep an
eye on it too. She's the
girl who will be his assistant.
Mengu.
İlbilge shares things with him that she doesn't share with anyone else.
You'll have to corner him too. There is no

text: Bu meseleyi başka türlü öğrenmenin yolu yoktur.
english: other way to learn about this matter .

text: Ben gidip bir göz atayım ağabey.
english: I'll go take a look, brother.
(Suspense music...)
(Silence) Are
you ready, sister? We'll be waiting for you.
I'm ready, sister.
You go out, I'll come too.
(Suspense music...)
(...) When you get to

text: Obaya gidince bunu Abdurrahman Alp'e ver.
english: the camp, give this to Abdurrahman Alp.
-He should pass this on to Ertuğrul Bey. -As you wish, madam.
(Suspense music)

text: Siz ne işler çevirirsiniz öyle, anlayacağım.
english: I'll figure out what kind of things you're up to.
(Suspense music)
Mashallah Bamsi.
You opened your eyes sooner than we expected. Thank
you very much, Mr. Artuk.
My only loss, in terms of my life, is... to perish without being able to
ask for forgiveness from my Ertuğrul Bey .
(Ertuğrul) Permission granted!
Peace be upon you. Wa alaikum assalam, sir
And peace be upon you, sir.
-(Artuk) With your permission, sir. -Thanks.
(Artuk) İlçin Hatun.
How are you, Bamsi? How are you?
I'm fine, I'm fine, thank God, sir.

text: Pusat yarasını sen de bilirsin beyim.
english: You know the pain of a gunshot, sir.

text: Üç, beş günde geçer. Lakin beyim...
english: It will pass in three to five days. But sir...
...the wound in my heart will never heal. It just keeps
burning me up.
What is it that's burning you up like this? It's
you, sir, it's you.
Sir, I wanted to come to you.
I was afraid you wouldn't see me.
I wanted to give you my voice, sir.
I was afraid you wouldn't hear me.
My lord, since you're angry with me...

text: ...o anda bütün cihan küsmüş gibi geldi.
english: ...it felt like the whole world was angry with me at that moment. Even if

text: Cihan bana küsse, ben sana yine küsmezdim Bamsı.
english: Cihan were mad at me, I still wouldn't be mad at you, Bamsı.
(Emotional music)
Our intention is not the heedless person, but heedlessness.
The fault lies with the mistake, not with the person who made the mistake.

text: Beyim, bu akılsız başımla seni çok üzdüm, bilirim.
english: My lord, I know I have greatly upset you with my foolishness.

text: Lakin ben ettiğim hataya bin nedamet getirdim beyim.
english: But sir, I deeply regret the mistake I made .
My lord, I considered you a lord. And here I am, I've

text: Aha da bu başıma bey kabul ettim.
english: accepted this man as my husband.
My lord, the loss of sanity... ...is due to
my ignorance.
But putting things in order is to your advantage.

text: Beyim, hata etmek, yine benim bilmezliğimdendir.
english: My lord, the mistake is again due to my own ignorance.
But forgiveness, however, is to your name.
My lord, perhaps...
...I am not even worthy of forgiveness.

text: Lakin beyliğin vermek olduğunu ben senden öğrendim.
english: But I learned from you that true leadership means giving. So many things pass through the

text: Şu fakirin gönlünden daha neler neler geçer de...
english: heart of this poor soul ... but my
tongue and palate are powerless to express them.

text: Beyim, ben senin yüreğindeki cömertliğe talibim.
english: My lord, I aspire to the generosity in your heart.

text: Biz ki seninle tuz, ekmek yoldaşıyız Bamsı.
english: We are like companions to you, Bamsi, sharing salt and bread.

text: Nice cenkte birbirimizin canına kalkan olduk.
english: In the great battle, we shielded each other's lives. There

text: Gün oldu kederi, gün oldu sevinci paylaştık.
english: were days when we shared sorrow, and days when we shared joy.

text: Sanma ki seni ötelemek bana kolay geldi.
english: Don't think that pushing you away was easy for me.
But the path to power is full of trials. There are times when

text: Yeri gelir en yakınlarınla imtihan olursun.
english: you are tested by those closest to you. If

text: Ben bu imtihanda tökezlersem, ardımdakilerin ahvali ne olur Bamsı?
english: I stumble in this test, what will become of those who follow me, Bamsi? Since
you have understood your mistake and repented,

text: ...Rabb'imiz affedici olduğu gibi bizlerden de affedici olmamızı ister.
english: our Lord, being forgiving, also wants us to be forgiving.
My lord...
...if you call me a hyena...
...well, I'll shoulder these mountain ranges right here.
You say I'm worn out...

text: ...aha da ocaktaki korları, közleri yerim beyim.
english: ...well, I'll eat the embers and coals from the hearth, sir.
My lord, tell me now...
...has your heart warmed to this crazy Bamsı?

text: Bamsı, gönlümüz bir vakit soğumuşsa da...
english: Bamsı, even though our hearts had grown cold for a while...
...it was your remorse and sincerity that would warm them. Once
our hearts are satisfied with your sincerity and remorse, will they not grow warmer
Never again... never
engage in combat without weapons.
Get well, put on your armor, and come to me.
Yes sir...
The order is yours.
(Music)
The command is yours.
The order is yours, sir.
The order is yours.
(Upbeat music)
(Suspense music)
Welcome, Mr. Beybolat. It was a
pleasure to see Abdurrahman Alpbaşı.
Ertuğrul Bey awaits you in his tent.
Good, good. Come on
Elder brother.

text: Ben Hafsa Hatun'u ziyaret edip, geçmiş olsun diyeyim.
english: I'll go visit Hafsa Hatun and wish her a speedy recovery. If you'll allow me,
brother.

text: Müsaade senin bacım, git o vakit.
english: You're welcome, sister, go ahead.
Ilbilge.
(Suspense music)
(Door opens)
Assalamu alaikum, Mr. Ertuğrul. Wa alaikum assalam,
Beybolat Bey.

text: Sırma Hatun nerededir? O gelmedi mi?
english: Where is Sırma Hatun? Didn't he come? He went to visit

text: Hafsa Hatun'a geçmiş olsuna gitti. Gelir birazdan.
english: Hafsa Hatun to offer his condolences. He'll be here soon. Please, come in
, don't leave me standing.
Thanks.
(Music...)

text: Bugün ettiğin yiğitliği duyduk Beybolat Bey.
english: We heard about the bravery you displayed today, Beybolat Bey.

text: Önce Albastı, sonra Dragos ve avanesi.
english: First Albastı, then Dragos and his gang. You and
Ertuğrul Bey fought side by side... and utterly destroyed the
infidels.
Söğüt is our homeland, Hayme Ana.

text: (Beybolat) Buraları muhafaza etmek de bizim vazifemiz.
english: (Beybolat) It is also our duty to protect these places.
We did our part.
As I said today...
...this matter won't end with Dragos alone.

text: Daha hesabı görülecek çok düşman vardır.
english: There are still many enemies to settle the score with. We need to stand

text: Hepsine karşı sırt sırta olmamız icap eder.
english: shoulder to shoulder against them all .
We are convinced that everything you do...

text: ...bu toprakların selameti için olduğuna kani olduk.
english: ...is for the safety and well-being of this land .
No matter who the enemy may be...

text: ...vazifemiz evvela senin yanında olmaktır Ertuğrul Bey.
english: ...our duty is first and foremost to stand by your side, Ertuğrul Bey. We have no doubt that you will

text: Senin hak namına her daim yanımızda olacağından...
english: always be on our side in the name of justice,
İlbilge Hatun.

text: Bizi bu uç topraklarında var edecek şey...
english: What will sustain us in these remote lands...
...is unity and loyalty.
Remember that...
...what turns our adversaries into a tyrannical enemy and
sets them against us...
...is our own divisions.

text: Eğer bir olursak, iri ve diri oluruz.
english: If we are united, we will be strong and powerful.

text: Hiçbir hasmımız karşımıza çıkmaya cesaret edemez.
english: No adversary dares to confront us.
(Music)
Where are you going like this?
Never before, madam... You and my sister used to whisper to each other

text: Ablamla fısır fısır ederdiniz gelmeden evvel.
english: before I arrived. So
, where are you going? Are
you hiding something from your wife?
Not at all, madam. Is it

text: Benim senden bir şey gizlemem mümkün mü?
english: possible for me to hide anything from you?

text: İlbilge Hatun, Abdurrahman Alp’e bir mektup vermemi istedi.

text: Hele ki sen bu gece onunla birlikte...
english: Especially since you said you wanted to
visit me in my tent tonight with him... ...
his suspicions will only increase. So what
then?

text: Tahminimce o da seninle birlikte obaya gelmek isteyecektir.
english: I imagine he'll want to come to the camp with you too.
He will try to find out what I know. Since you can't talk to

text: Benimle otağda baş başa konuşamayacağın için...
english: me alone in the tent ...
...you will give me a letter secretly.

text: Mektupta bana bahsettiğin yaralı yüzlü adamla ilgili konuşmak istediğini...
english: In your letter, you'll write that you want to talk about the man with the scarred face you mentioned...
...and that you'll be waiting at the place where we always meet.
Your task, İlbilge Hatun, is to ensure that the letter

text: ...Beybolat'ın eline geçmesini sağlamak olacaktır İlbilge Hatun.
english: reaches Beybolat's hands .
(Intermission)
Those who hide in the darkness of betrayal...
...are destined to be revealed in the sun of justice .
(Suspense music)
Take your men and go inside.

text: Ben burada beyimizin emrini yerine getirip, emniyete alacağım.
english: I will carry out my master's order here and ensure safety.
Ertuğrul could arrive any moment.
(Suspense music)
Damn, it was a trap!
Call our men who were ambushed. Don't leave

text: (Baturalp) Beybolat Bey'i yalnız bırakmayın! Koşun, acele edin!
english: (Baturalp) Beybolat Bey alone ! Run, hurry!
(Suspense music...)
The Alps...

text: ...bu itlerin hesabını görüp beyimizi yalnız koymayacağız.
english: ...we will settle the score with these dogs and not leave our lord alone.
(They drew their swords)
(Suspense music)
(Ertuğrul) Your veil will now fall. Up until now
we have seen the face of Beybolat...
...from now on we will see the face of Albastı.
(Suspense music...)
(Thunder effect)
(Suspense music)
(Thunder effect)
(Opening theme music...)
(Music)
